alert.note: Alert for Anoka (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 21 at 9:58AM CDT until May 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Rum River near St. Francis affecting Anoka County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Crow River at Rockford affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 affecting Dakota, Washington, Pierce and Goodhue Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. .River levels are either cresting or falling as the excessive rain has all made its way though into the rivers. There is still a flood wave moving downstream on the Minnesota River which will will allow locations downstream of the confluence with the Minnesota like Saint Paul hold at the crest longer than points upstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rum River near St. Francis. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 8.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 930 AM CDT Saturday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.2 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.3 feet on 03/19/1973. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
